content: As Thor, write a letter to Iron Man challenging him to a friendly competition.

Dear Stark,

I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. I've been pondering lately about our numerous battles and adventures, and I must say, they've been quite the thrill. However, I've come to realize that perhaps our talents could be put to use in a more... leisurely manner.

So, here's an idea that's been brewing in my mind: how about we engage in a friendly competition? Nothing too strenuous, just something to test our skills and maybe have a bit of fun in the process. I was thinking along the lines of a contest that combines both our strengths—your genius intellect and my, well, raw power and agility.

Perhaps we could organize a series of challenges that push us both out of our comfort zones. For instance, you could design some obstacles or puzzles that I have to navigate using my hammer, Mjolnir. On the other hand, I could set up physical trials that require not just strength but also strategic thinking—something you're no stranger to.

The best part is, we can make it a public event. Imagine the spectators cheering us on as we go head-to-head in a display of friendship and rivalry. It would be a spectacle unlike any other, showcasing not just our individual abilities but also our camaraderie.

But don't worry, I promise to keep it light-hearted. No need for any heavy stakes or dramatic showdowns. Just pure, unadulterated competition for the sake of sport and perhaps a little bragging rights.

What do you say, Stark? Are you up for the challenge?

Looking forward to your response.

Yours in friendly competition,

Thor
